column3: Caledonian Sleeper: London Euston → Glasgow Central
column6: Board the overnight sleeper. Seats (not cabins); grab a beer in the dining car — the trip starts here. Arrives Glasgow ~07:00.
easyJet/BA from Heathrow Gatwick or Luton to Glasgow International. ~1hr 20min. Requires onward transfer to Ardrossan — adds phaff, but works.
Wake up in Scotland (train) or transfer from airport (flight). Grab a deep fried Mars bar near the station.
~50 min train through Ayrshire timed to connect with the ferry.
55-minute crossing on the Firth of Clyde. First proper hit of sea air — stags properly started.
First meal on the island. The Brodick Bar does solid pub grub. Fuel up — there's a big hill ahead.
Arran's highest peak at 874m. A 4–5hr return from Brodick. Stunning views to Ireland and the Highlands on a clear day. Trail starts a short walk from the village.
Well earned. The Brodick Bar or Douglas Hotel. Keep an eye on the clock — bus leaves at 19:10.
Last bus of the day on this route. ~40 mins of coastal scenery. Arrives Lochranza ~19:53. Don't miss it.
Drop bags shower change. Book the whole dorm for group privacy. Breakfast included.
Two-minute walk from the hostel. Local local atmosphere good whisky selection and views over the castle and loch. A proper island pub night.
Hostel breakfast included in your £30.25. Fuel up before the morning activity.
Head back down for the morning activity. Departs Lochranza ~10:30 arrives Brodick ~11:10.
Arran Adventure Co. runs both. Coasteering — jumping off sea rocks into the Firth — is perfect post-night-out energy.
Right in Brodick. A guided tour and whisky tasting — the perfect send-off before the ferry. Book in advance.
The island disappearing behind you — always a good sign you picked the right place.
Quick hop back to Glasgow.

column3: Avanti West Coast: Glasgow Central → London Euston
column6: ~4.5hr return. Arrive London ~23:30. Book advance tickets.
easyJet/BA from Glasgow GLA back to London. ~1hr 20min. Airport overhead adds ~2hrs vs the train.
